author: Special Correspondent
text:
“Pre-natal care will go a long way in checking disability”

Speakers at an awareness programme on ‘Prevention and early intervention to check disability’ sponsored by the Social Welfare Department here on Friday, stressed the importance of early identification and intervention of disabilities, taking due advantage of the latest scientific and technological development. They said that pre-natal care will go a long way in checking disability.

T. Karikalan, District Collector, who inaugurated the programme, said that there was a strong case for creating awareness among the pregnant women in checking deformation.

P. Chitra, Jaffin Basheer, Vidhya Meena and T. Santhamurthy – all resource persons from Health Department, explained the challenges being faced by differently-abled persons and their parents. Early detection would go a long way in checking the problem. In the present-day technologically-advanced scenario, remedial measures for checking disability had been made easy.

G. Pari, Welfare Officer, spoke on the objective of the programme.
title: Need to check disability
